,TRUE,5,5,5,3,3 turtlestack","2016-02-06T20:43:30.693Z","LEGO at its finest","

This feels like one of those sets that will be looked at as a classic. There is just something about how charming this set is that seems, to me, to define what LEGO is
column2: all about. In fact if I had to explain to an alien species what LEGO is all about I would give them this set.&nbsp

m not an expert LEGO builder nor have I been seriously into LEGO for very long, but I get the feeling that if you ever wanted to learn how some people on the internet and at conventions build those beautiful MOC buildings with all the fantastic little details this is the set where you can learn many of those techniques at their basic level.

column1: Every single step of this build teaches you how to make a sturdy, functional, and also beautiful
column2: model. Details such as the exposed ends of the log beams, to the stove, bed, and writing desk, and the way the yard, ground, dock, and water are worked into the overall model are simple, sturdy, and effective. Nothing about this build feels cheap, there are no shortcuts where you have to use your imagination to see what the designer intended - everything about this model is charming and looks fantastic. Even the moose is great (and is why I initially picked this up from the shelf at the store).

column1: I would imagine this set would look very nice with
column2: <a href=""http://brickset.com/sets/60117-1/Van-Caravan"">60117:&nbsp
column9: m absolutely going to at least get the Van and Caravan to make a fun little vacation getaway scene.

column1: I love this set and can'
column2: t recommend it enough! This is LEGO at its best.

LegoAthos","2016-03-05T02:44:46.82Z","Makes me Want to Move to Alaska","
Box/Instructions
The instructions were easy enough to follow.
Parts
Great parts. Lots of basic brick in brown. Love the tan and green windows. The 2x2 round plates with holes in the middle (lily pads) are a nice touch. There is also a brown one in the tree.
column3: d like some more of these.

column1: Minifigures
Not a very exciting minifigure, though the black hair piece is (I think) new to me.
The build
Straight forward brick on brick build. Just the kind I like. Reminds me of the sets I had as a kid.
The completed model

Very nice model. Like the title says, it makes me want to (well maybe not move but) visit Alaska and stay in a log cabin for an extended vacation. The tree is a neat design. The moose will be fun for my kids to play with.
Overall opinion
One of the best sets I'
column2: ve build in a while. I like creator buildings, but the combination of brown and creator was great. I liked this one a lot more than the Deli set. It feels more substantial than the Deli, which felt like&nbsp
column3: disappointingly small model. This one, however, feels just the right size.

column1: The Lodge feels a bit overpriced at MSRP, but at 20% off, it was a good deal. I'
column2: m considerina 2nd one...

column1: I rarely write reviews, but I think this one deserved the effort.

,TRUE,5,5,5,3,4 conservationist","2016-05-08T10:08:51.55Z","A Lazy Lodge","

A must have from day 1, this set captured my attention with its generally lazy atmosphere and setting. A wonderful piece by the Lego Group, this lodge captures the serenity of countryside living.
Box/Instructions

Standard Creator box, the frontal background fits the setting very much while the reverse shows the other forms that can be constructed. The bags are unnumbered and each alternate build has its own little instruction booklet.
Parts

The parts were diverse and included many brown pieces in different shapes and sizes. In my opinion, the small 1x1 pieces in assorted colours were the best as they added different texture and highlights to the structure.
Minifigures
A rather standard minifigure. The hairpiece adds a little more character to the minifigure.
The build

The build was excellent and extremely simple. The addition of the details at specific parts of the build kept me hooked to see which other detail they would add next. For no particular reason, I especially liked the simple bed made of medium blue and the hanging lamp outside the doorway.
The build of the moose surprised me as the legs used a technique I have not come across before. Then again I have not built many brick animals.
The completed model

The model looks fantastic and portrays the scene of a lonely mountain lodge tucked in the wilderness. It has sufficient details on both the exterior and interior. The use of rounded green plates also helped to break up the straight lines and make the model seem more natural, giving the set more character.
Overall opinion

This set makes me feel kind of lazy. For a city dweller like me, fiddling with this set every once in awhile would evoke scenes of peace and quietness. I believe that this set would be perfect for everyone, regardless of age. The only problem would be the price point, a reduction of several dollars would make this set a must get.

,TRUE,5,5,5,4,4 KingAlanI","2017-05-29T14:57:30.7Z","Small but very detailed","

The bed was covered in tiles so the figure wouldn&#39

column3: t use the tiles. However, I liked Slope 30 1x2x2/3 (part 85984) as a pillow. The yellow chair outside did not have this problem.

column3: t stay put, could get lost if the model doesn&#39
column4: t stay level. Kitchen accoutrements in LEGO sets are often like that.

column1: The roof could be built before attaching to the cabin walls.
The hinges were good to open the model for display and play.
I don&#39
column2: t like it at full price, but it was fine on sale.
